meanings.definition: A type of building material made of gypsum plaster sandwiched between layers of paper.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers installed plasterboards on the walls to create a smooth surface.
meanings.sent2: The new house had walls covered with plasterboards for insulation.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous cat tried to climb the plasterboards, it left tiny claw marks behind.
meanings.sent4: The layers of paper on the plasterboards held the gypsum plaster together like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: As I touched the plasterboards, I could feel the coolness of the gypsum underneath.

meanings.definition: To cover or decorate with plasterboards.
meanings.sent1: The interior designer decided to plasterboard the ceiling to give it a modern look.
meanings.sent2: We will plasterboard the entire room to make it more aesthetically pleasing.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to plasterboard their playhouse with imaginary materials.
meanings.sent4: She plasterboarded the stage with colorful panels for the school play.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter carefully plasterboarded the walls, ensuring a seamless finish.
